b2fcd9c65d97.description: A compendium of articles examining Tech’s ongoing challenges with building inclusive workplace cultures, and telling the stories of those feeling the impacts the most.

header.description: A compendium of articles examining Tech’s ongoing culture problem with inclusivity, and telling the stories of those feeling the impacts the most.
header.title: Tech Diversity Files

b2fcd9c65d97.name: Tech Diversity Files
b2fcd9c65d97.shortDescription: A compendium of articles examining Tech’s ongoing…

collectionHeaderMetadata.description: A compendium of articles examining Tech’s ongoing culture problem with inclusivity, and telling the stories of those feeling the impacts the most.
collectionHeaderMetadata.title: Tech Diversity Files

paragraphs.text: If you are going to throw money at diversity causes, throw it at improving and diversifying the interview process too. Think about the expectations you set for junior vs. senior people. Think about hiring people that you can grow into a leader. Have empathy, because we all know how much interviews can damage a person’s self-esteem and reduce the opportunities they can pursue.
paragraphs.name: bfe6

paragraphs.text: Answer an online coding challenge that is timed, auto-compiled, auto-marked, and has unclear instructions on what the output type is.
paragraphs.name: d83c

paragraphs.text: In most cases, I have sighed, attempted to solve the question disgruntled, failed the interview, and was told later that I did not have “enough experience” or “come back when the experience is there”. People seeking entry level positions do not have the luxury to call out bullshit to the their interviewers. Inquiring about team and company culture (including mental health support) is seen as an addenda, something that cuts into precious interview time. Let’s face it, talking about interview grievances with recruiters rarely fixes anything for you or future candidates.
paragraphs.name: a7e7

paragraphs.text: In a specific language, describe how a data structure (array, hash map, etc.) is implemented underneath the hood.
paragraphs.name: dbf7

paragraphs.text: Write a mathematical proof justifying why an algorithm you designed for a graph problem is correct.
paragraphs.name: 5ad3

paragraphs.text: I shit you not, despite my qualifications, I have been asked from men the following nonsense in interviews:
paragraphs.name: 3c5e

paragraphs.text: For new grads and others looking for entry level positions, no one gives you the benefit of the doubt, even when it is on paper. Your experiences are never quite “good enough” even though you are not demanding to be in a senior position. You have to go through rings of fire just to prove you have the standard skills for a software engineer.
“Just study this how-to book the size of your head on algorithms and interviewing and you’ll be set!”
paragraphs.name: 26d9

paragraphs.text: How do people who do not have the same privileges as me even get through the door? The harsh reality is that they don’t.
paragraphs.name: 2e6d

paragraphs.text: Regurgitate classic CS algorithms that no one will ever have to design or implement themselves again.
paragraphs.name: 3af0

paragraphs.text: Answer questions about operating systems and networking for a position that only has high-level, application-level programming.

e60cf973b7eb.title: For the little experience I have had doing interviews, at least partially, I am really baffled when…

paragraphs.text: For the little experience I have had doing interviews, at least partially, I am really baffled when I hear about how others do interviews. Nobody except people doing some particular kinds of research, working in AI, or improving core algorithms will ever need to manually sort a list. Everybody working anywhere has the internet, a repl, and all the…
paragraphs.name: a9c7

abc1b2594b39.title: I personally hate weeding tools, there are classes at my university that are meant to do nothing…

paragraphs.text: I personally hate weeding tools, there are classes at my university that are meant to do nothing but cut down on the number of students that make it through certain programs. Its not that companies or institutions care about everyone making it through, but whether they have the resources to care for everyone that could possibly make it through…
paragraphs.name: ef4c

virtuals.subtitle: But hey, you can be that cheerleader for someone now, and so can I.

content.subtitle: But hey, you can be that cheerleader for someone now, and so can I.

effd0540bb94.title: As your teachers hopefully explained, you learned those algorithms in school not because you’d have…

paragraphs.text: As your teachers hopefully explained, you learned those algorithms in school not because you’d have to implement them again, but to learn about ideas in algorithm design.
I’ll agree that most programming jobs need no more than using hash tables, but if I’m hiring a CS grad I’m probably looking for more than the everyday minimum.
paragraphs.name: df0f

virtuals.subtitle: I’ll agree that most programming jobs need no more than using hash tables, but if I’m hiring a CS grad I’m probably looking for more than…

content.subtitle: I’ll agree that most programming jobs need no more than using hash tables, but if I’m hiring a CS grad I’m probably looking for more than…

af445a58ef54.title: This starts being unfair, but without seeing the unclear instructions I can’t decide whether and…

paragraphs.text: This starts being unfair, but without seeing the unclear instructions I can’t decide whether and for whom they’re unclear. (I’ve done timed, autocompiled and automarked coding challenges).
paragraphs.name: 4b74

628e8255fe04.title: Thank you for penning this down…I was under the impression that I was “weak” and “dumb” for not…

paragraphs.text: Thank you for penning this down…I was under the impression that I was “weak” and “dumb” for not knowing most of the answers during some interviews….I always left feeling insufficient cause I was not a math/puzzle buff.

The books work though. Everyone, even interviewers and recruiters, agrees that knowing algorithms and data structures isn’t necessary for day-to-day software roles, but these things are meant to be like the SAT. Not perfect, and definitely not preferable, but mainly meant to efficiently cut down the number of possible candidates for further, more fine tuned interview processes.
paragraphs.name: 1f45

428d9ba49471.title: Part of algorithms textbooks, and useful to check whether the algorithm you wrote is correct.

paragraphs.text: Part of algorithms textbooks, and useful to check whether the algorithm you wrote is correct. I’ll admit I often reason stuff is correct without doing more than a proof sketch in my head, depending on how tricky are things.
paragraphs.name: 95ad

paragraphs.text: Also, by calling proving “nonsense”, you’ve just given a good reason to not hire you to companies who care about writing correct software.
paragraphs.name: b29b

virtuals.subtitle: Also, by calling proving “nonsense”, you’ve just given a good reason to not hire you to companies who care about writing correct software.

content.subtitle: Also, by calling proving “nonsense”, you’ve just given a good reason to not hire you to companies who care about writing correct software.

91b095d0289a.title: I sure could use a technical interviewer’s cookbook (i.e.

paragraphs.text: I sure could use a technical interviewer’s cookbook (i.e. a list of good technical interview ideas). Seriously. I’ve done these interviews, and I’ve no clue on what I should be doing, and everyone I know seems to be doing things that seem impractical. Being asked to choose a sorting algorithm and describe its O(n) time complexity, when the most…
paragraphs.name: de7d

df7ece7f68d7.title: I prefer holistic interviews too, but as long as companies and schools get more candidates than…

paragraphs.text: I prefer holistic interviews too, but as long as companies and schools get more candidates than they have positions, they’re in the position where they could replace you with any of the ten other people next to you and it wouldn’t make a big difference to their bottom line. I think a bigger problem is that the companies dont effectively communicate…

632c56db3b0b.title: Thanks for the shout out :) Interview processes that leave candidates feeling “weak” or “dumb” are…

paragraphs.text: Thanks for the shout out :) Interview processes that leave candidates feeling “weak” or “dumb” are just broken. They should be a learning experience — an opportunity to explore a company/team and the problems you can potentially help to solve.
paragraphs.name: 434a

paragraphs.text: That’s fun. Most of the questions you list check that you’re a good CS student, and don’t seem about experience. You claim to come from a good school, so you should have an advantage in those questions.

e2730ebcc991.title: I understand that having “rings of fire” is a weeding tool.

paragraphs.text: I understand that having “rings of fire” is a weeding tool. It’s a skill to be able to jump through these rings and also come out with a self-esteem in tact at the end. It’s not a skill most people are taught, especially underrepresented people who don’t always have cheerleaders along the way. Thanks Sumanth for taking the time to respond :)
paragraphs.name: e730

bee0b4b96c62.title: It took a LONG time, but I finally found a company that interviewed in a thorough yet smart, fair…

paragraphs.text: It took a LONG time, but I finally found a company that interviewed in a thorough yet smart, fair, and fun way: a reasonable, real-life-problem-oriented take-home initial coding assignment that was not timed or forced; discussion of the assignment at an onsite interview; brainstorm-style discussion of some real-work problems the company faces on a…
paragraphs.name: f8c5

e76b129c9f57.title: There are questions on networking that are essentials for, say, AJAX developers.

paragraphs.text: There are questions on networking that are essentials for, say, AJAX developers. (I’d ask about the link between performance and number of roundtrips).
paragraphs.name: 820c

paragraphs.text: But here I guess you imply “not web programming”.

423b8e4fdee1.title: As a Canadian student who never had to go through the SATs, I have much preferred interviews…

paragraphs.text: As a Canadian student who never had to go through the SATs, I have much preferred interviews/applications/etc. that are focused on building your portfolio, network because they show how well-rounded a candidate is (including their technical skill set). The topic of efficiency is interesting… I think there can be ways to process candidates efficiently…
paragraphs.name: c9ea

7b862c19862.title: I really like the idea of a technical interviewer’s cookbook!

paragraphs.text: I really like the idea of a technical interviewer’s cookbook! There’s so many books on how to be the interviewee, but the interviewer also has a huge responsibility as well. Thanks Bao for sharing :)
paragraphs.name: 6cfa

feddafd058ea.title: We don’t go through the door.

paragraphs.text: We don’t go through the door. We climb up the glass drainpipe, scissor-step across the 3-inch-wide glass ledge and then climb in through the unlocked window of bias hacking.

e4c61af4e4f3.title: A lot of the jumping through rings of fire is intended to weed out “false positive” candidates…

paragraphs.text: A lot of the jumping through rings of fire is intended to weed out “false positive” candidates within companies. Its not preferable but its an easy crutch for companies to use when they just need people to get qualified candidates and nothing more. Feel free to prove me wrong, but i dont think this is an issue of privilege or gender, everybody goes…

f299ab50d5d1.title: But that’s one more reason to hire top students even for entry-level jobs, if leaders are to have…

paragraphs.text: But that’s one more reason to hire top students even for entry-level jobs, if leaders are to have more varied technical competence. I understand that’s maybe not what you think about a leader, but that’s an important component too; few people can lead without excellent technical abilities.
paragraphs.name: 3a4a

virtuals.subtitle: Of course you also need social competence for leadership, and you’re probably right that that’s not selected enough for.
